( Sorry I'm late and all. Just got home from a friends house and all.)


* BrightBlade soon found herself smiling at Lightmare�s comment on her claim 
on Gangon, as if that move wasn't predictable! She had seen the way that the 
two of them had been looking at each other, but she had also seen the way 
that the more that Gangon looked at the new bot then more likely she was to 
loose her partner. It was as the saying went, � Out with the old and in with 
the new.� Herself being the old and Lightmare being the new. But then why 
should she care? It wasn�t as if Gangon had ever loved her, just said that 
she was beautiful, protected her and that was it. Or at least that was what 
she thought. Just saying that a bot happened to look nice and helping them 
didn�t mean that they loved them, and a lot of other bots would be shocked 
out of their minds if it ever did!
BrightBlade then leaned on one leg and looked away from both of them but 
kept an optic on Lightmare.*

� I�d watch what you say to me, Old Nellie. Or you might end up as a pot of 
glue!�

*She then transformed back into her beast mode but then began to walk 
towards Gangon as he laied in the ground. When she finally came up beside 
his fainted form and looked down, a simple and emotionless expression on her 
face .She then created and downloaded this message so that he would see it 
even as he was blacked out:*
� You can either come back to base with me�or stay here with that walking 
cow pie. But I�m going back to base to continue my duties.�

* With that BrightBlade then began to walk slowly towards the Predacon ship. 
If Gangon was to wake up and follow her then it would mean that he wanted to 
continue being her partner, if not then their partnership was through and he 
then had Lightmare as his new partner. That was as she saw it, it was either 
her or Lightmare.Two was a peace bond but three was a crowd! The choice was 
his and only histo make, even though she new that she would be left by 
herself again...working solo as she alway had before. She really didn�t care 
which, she had worked alone before and it wasn�t anything new to her.*
